histogram.name: Sql.Database.Open.FailureReason.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary: Reports the fine-grained reason for a failure in Database::Open. Recorded once per failure to open the {DatabaseTag} database.

histogram.name: Sql.Database.Open.FirstAttempt.Error.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary: Reports sqlite errors triggered during the first attempt at opening the {DatabaseTag} database.

histogram.name: Sql.Database.Open.SecondAttempt.Error.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary: Reports sqlite errors triggered during the second attempt at opening the {DatabaseTag} database. Databases can sometimes trigger a second open attempt if the caller-provided error callback razes the database on open failure.

histogram.name: Sql.Database.Success.OpenInternalTime.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary:
Reports the time spent in OpenInternal, in microseconds, when opening the {DatabaseTag} database.
Only reported for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Sql.Database.Success.SqliteOpenTime.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary:
Reports the time spent in the sqlite3_open_v2 library call, in microseconds, when opening the {DatabaseTag} database.
Only reported for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Sql.Recovery.Result
histogram.summary: Outcome of attempting to recover a database with sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sql.Recovery.Result.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary: Outcome of attempting to recover the {DatabaseTag} database with sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Sql.Recovery.ResultCode
histogram.summary: SQLite result code from attempting to recover a database with sql::Recovery. Note that kNoError does not necessarily indicate that recovery succeeded (see Sql.Recovery.Result for that information), since not all recoveries fail due to SQLite errors (e.g. if a version number could not be read from the meta table).

histogram.name: Sql.Recovery.ResultCode.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary: SQLite result code from attempting to recover the {DatabaseTag} database with sql::Recovery. Note that kNoError does not necessarily indicate that recovery succeeded (see Sql.Recovery.Result for that information), since not all recoveries fail due to SQLite errors (e.g. if a version number could not be read from the meta table).

histogram.name: Sql.Statement.ExecutionTime.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary:
Reports the total time spent stepping for a given statement in database {DatabaseTag}, in microseconds. Recorded when the statement is reset/destructed, but only includes the time spent in `StepInternal` since the statement's last reset.
Only reported for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Sql.Statement.StepTime.{DatabaseTag}
histogram.summary:
Reports the time of a single step of a statement running against {DatabaseTag}, in microseconds. Recorded every time `Step` is called.
Only reported for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Sql.Statement.{DatabaseTag}.VMSteps
Sql.vfs.SyncTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to sync SQLite data to disk. The metric is recorded once per flush. A SQLite operation may require multiple sync operation to ensure database consistency.
